org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.requests

Interface Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>

  • Type Parameters:
    RESPONSE_TYPE - The type response value.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AppBase.AsyncBladeRequest, AppBase.SyncBladeRequest, AsyncRequest, BladeBase.AsyncBladeRequest, BladeBase.SyncBladeRequest, DelayAReq, IncDesImpl.AsyncBladeRequest, IncDesImpl.SyncBladeRequest, PropertiesTransactionAReq, SubscribeAReq, SyncRequest, TransactionAReq

    public interface Request<RESPONSE_TYPE>
    A request is a single-use object used to perform an operation safely and to optionally be pass back with a response value that is also processed safely.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      RequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE> asRequestImpl()
      Returns the object used to implement the request.
      RESPONSE_TYPE call()
      Passes this request and then blocks the source thread until the request is returned with a response value.
      Reactor getSourceReactor()
      Returns the source reactor, or null.
      Reactor getTargetReactor()
      Returns the Reactor that provides the thread context in which this request will operate.
      boolean isCanceled()
      Returns true if the request is canceled or the thread is interrupted.
      boolean isClosed()
      Returns true if the request is closed.
      void onCancel()
      An optional callback used to signal that the request has been canceled.
      void onClose()
      An optional callback used to signal that the request has been closed.
      void signal()
      Passes this Request to the target Reactor without any result being passed back.

    • Method Detail

      • asRequestImpl

        RequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE> asRequestImpl()
        Returns the object used to implement the request.
        Returns:
        The object used to implement the request.

      • getTargetReactor

        Reactor getTargetReactor()
        Returns the Reactor that provides the thread context in which this request will operate.
        Returns:
        The target Reactor.

      • call

        RESPONSE_TYPE call()
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Passes this request and then blocks the source thread until the request is returned with a response value. This method can not be called within the thread context of a reactor.
        Returns:
        The result value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • signal

        void signal()
     throws java.lang.Exception
        Passes this Request to the target Reactor without any result being passed back. I.E. The signal method results in a 1-way message being passed. If an exception is thrown while processing this Request, that exception is simply logged as a warning.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getSourceReactor

        Reactor getSourceReactor()
        Returns the source reactor, or null. A null is returned if the request was passed using the signal or call methods.
        Returns:
        The source reactor or null.

      • isCanceled

        boolean isCanceled()
        Returns true if the request is canceled or the thread is interrupted. Closing the source reactor, for example, will result in the request being canceled. Thread.interrupted is also called to see if the thread is interrupted. This method should ideally be called periodically within long loops.
        Returns:
        True if the request is canceled or the thread is interrupted.

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Returns true if the request is closed. Closing the target reactor, for example, will result in the request being closed.
        Returns:
        True if the request is canceled.

      • onCancel

        void onCancel()
        An optional callback used to signal that the request has been canceled. This method must be thread-safe, as there is no constraint on which thread is used to call it. By default, onCancel does nothing.

      • onClose

        void onClose()
        An optional callback used to signal that the request has been closed. This method must be thread-safe, as there is no constraint on which thread is used to call it. By default, onClose does nothing.
